name: Million Bells
climate: Million Bells thrive in warm climates, where temperatures are moderate.
They prefer temperate zones, avoiding extreme hot or cold conditions.
A mild, non-arid climate is ideal for Million Bells to flourish.
They grow best in climates that do not experience severe frost.
sunlight: Million Bells need full sun for most of the day to bloom optimally.
They perform best in conditions with a minimum of six hours of sunlight.
Partial shade may be tolerated, but full blooming might be reduced.
Direct sunlight exposure ensures vibrant and continuous flowering.
watering: Regular watering is required, ensuring the soil remains moist but not waterlogged.
Avoid letting the soil dry out completely to maintain healthy growth.
During hot weather, more frequent watering may be necessary.
Ensure good drainage to prevent root rot due to excessive water.
soil: A well-draining soil mix is essential to prevent water retention issues.
Million Bells prefer a slightly acidic to neutral soil for healthy blooms.
The soil should retain moisture but also allow excess water to escape.
Incorporating organic matter can improve soil structure and nutrient content.
extra_care_tip: Million Bells benefit from regular pinching to encourage bushier growth.
Fertilize monthly during the growing season with a balanced fertilizer.
Deadheading spent blooms can promote continuous flowering.
Watch for signs of pests like aphids and treat promptly to prevent damage.
